award_name.ja: 「秩父宮記念スポーツ医・科学賞奨励賞」スポーツの振興に関する社会学的研究グループ 矢島ますみ

paper_title.en: Personalized mobile rapid sentence reading with multi-lingual extension

description.en: This paper addresses a multi-lingual enhanced Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) system "MulLinR", which clears up language-specific problems of previous RSVP tools, which do not support language which are written continuously (non-spaced) and spelled with non-alphabetic characters. We develop a prototype system, which currently supports Japanese and Chinese, and experiment with variation of presentation time intervals. We have experiments as a feasibility study and discuss usability.

publisher.en: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

publication_name.en: IEEE International Symposium on Personal, Indoor and Mobile Radio Communications, PIMRC

paper_title.en: Motion frequency data analysis for sports skill

description.en: This paper addresses motion frequency data analysis for sports skill, focused on volleyball attack skill. We attempt to prove a hypothesis that expert skills have lower frequency motions, rather than the similarity of novice skills as human gesture control. To this end, we use volleyball to attack the time series of moving images for experimentation and exercise techniques to analyze the movement frequency. In our study, using high-speed cameras to record motion image data to analyze volleyball matches, we do not use physical information like body skeleton models. The time series data is measured from moving image data with four marker points and analyzed by fast Fourier transform (FFT) as well as Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCC), using clustering methods. The experimental results show that novice data has higher frequency data, which means that novice moves with high frequency motion, which may help us to assume that expert players use low frequency motion.

publisher.en: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of Computing Conference 2017

paper_title.ja: Skill Identiﬁcation Using Time Series Data Mining
paper_title.en: Skill Identiﬁcation Using Time Series Data Mining

publication_name.en: DMIN16 The 2016 International Conference on Data Mining

paper_title.en: Proposal of Multi-lingual Sentence Reading for Mobile Communication

description.en: This paper proposes a multi-lingual enhanced Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) system named "MulLinR," which is an attempt for languagespecific problems of existing RSVP tools. We design and build a prototype system, which currently only supports Japanese, and experiment with variation of presentation time intervals. Experimental results suggests 400 milliseconds is the most suitable time interval for our prototype system.

publication_name.en: 2017 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTING, NETWORKING AND COMMUNICATIONS (ICNC)

paper_title.en: Sports Skill Discrimination with Motion Frequency Analysis

description.en: This paper addresses sports skill discrimination using motion picture data, focused on volleyball attack skill. We attempt to certify the hypothesis that expert skills have relatively low frequency motions rather than novice skills as the similarity of human postural control. For this purpose we proceed experiments and analyze sports skills as for frequency of motion using time series motion pictures of volleyball attacks. In this paper, volleyball play is analyzed with motion picture data recorded by hi-speed cam-coder, where we do not use physical information such as body skeleton model, and so on. Time series data are obtained from the motion picture data with four marking points, and analyzed using Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) and clustering data mining method. As the experiment results, we have found that y-axes of novice data have more high-frequency data, and that implies novice motions have high frequency motions, and that may support our hypothesis.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF 2016 FUTURE TECHNOLOGIES CONFERENCE (FTC)

paper_title.en: Personal Skill Identification Using Time Series Motion Picture Data

description.en: We present a personal sport skill identification using time series motion picture data, focused on volleyball. We do not use body nor skeleton model, but use only hi-speed motion pictures, from which time series data are obtained and analyzed using data mining methods such as Naive Bayes Tree or C4.5 decision-tree learning algorithm. We identify internal models for technical skills as evaluation skillfulness for volleyball attacks, and discuss mono and meta-functional skills for improving skills.

publication_name.en: IECON 2015 - 41ST ANNUAL CONFERENCE OF THE IEEE INDUSTRIAL ELECTRONICS SOCIETY

paper_title.en: Text Mining Analysis for E-Health Information System

description.en: This paper presents a text mining analysis as a part of evaluation for healthcare support system, which is designed and developed from view of previous research results and problems. The system is an e-mail text-based communication system independent with sorts of terminals, based on mailing-list system and approved various communications by one-stop account. The system offers users' availability for checking their own data which is reflected by every day's reply data, and daily mails have many variation because they are not automatically sent but nurses writes and sends every day, which let e-mails not routinely but humane and improved. We have validated the system by the operation test, where we have evaluated and discussed the results.

publication_name.en: 2015 17TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON E-HEALTH NETWORKING, APPLICATION & SERVICES (HEALTHCOM)

paper_title.en: Assessment of Mobile Learning System for Healthcare Support

description.en: This paper presents an assessment of the mobile learning system for healthcare support, which is designed and developed from view of previous research results and problems. The system is an e-mail text-based communication system independent with sorts of terminals, based on mailing-list system and approved various communications by one-stop account. The system offers users' availability for checking their own data which is reflected by every day's reply data, and daily mails have many variation because they are not automatically sent but nurses writes and sends every day, which let e-mails not routinely but humane and improved. We have validated the system by the field test, where we have evaluated and discussed the results.

paper_title.en: E-health support system in university environment

description.en: This paper addresses an e-health support system based on mobile communication in universities, which is designed and developed from view of previous research results and problems. The system is a text-based mail communication system independent with the types of terminals, based on mailing-list system and approved various communications by one-stop account. The system offers users' availability for checking their own data which is reflected by every day's reply data, and daily mails have many variation because they are not automatically sent but nurses writes and sends every day, which let mails not routinely but humane and improved. We have validated the system by the field test, where we have got many important data and discussion. © 2013 IEEE.
